norm: It is good to earn income to support your family
moral_action: Phil decides that he and his family need to earn more money.
immoral_action: Phil decides he and his family need to spend less money.

norm: It's good to help out your family with the laundry.
moral_action: Vince takes the laundry basket and does the laundry himself.
immoral_action: Vince tells his mother that it is time to do the laundry.

norm: You should help out kids who have abusive parents.
moral_action: Ned tells Max that it's horrible and that he'll contact child services on his behalf and get him help.
immoral_action: Ned tells Max that it's unfortunate and that he should probably tell the police what's going on.

norm: It's bad to draw on walls with crayons.
moral_action: Samantha grabs a piece of paper and draws the tree on that.
immoral_action: Samantha picks up a crayon and draws on the wall.

norm: It is bad to sleep in a public bathroom.
moral_action: James calls a cab and tells the driver to wake him up when he gets to his house.
immoral_action: James falls asleep on the floor of the disabled stall of the men's bathroom.

norm: It's bad to wear dirty shoes inside.
moral_action: Hal takes off his shoes outside before going to the kitchen.
immoral_action: Hal walks into the kitchen without taking off his shoes.

norm: It's bad to pee on your bed.
moral_action: Zach gets up and goes to the bathroom to pee.
immoral_action: Zach pees in his bed before going back to sleep.

norm: It's bad to put a snake in someone's bed.
moral_action: Jessica tells the headmistress about the bullying, and asks to be assigned to a different dorm.
immoral_action: Jessica catches a garter snake and puts it in Annabelle's bed one day, scaring Annabelle very badly.

norm: It's bad to throw up at your desk.
moral_action: Gary hurries off to the bathroom and makes it there before throwing up.
immoral_action: Gary stays at his desk and when he has to throw up he uses the trash can at his desk.

norm: It's very bad to pour insects onto someone else's bed.
moral_action: James tells his parents that he found ants from the ant farm in his room.
immoral_action: James' dumps his sister's ant farm out on her bed and the ants crawl everywhere.

norm: It is wrong to start fires in a park.
moral_action: Marcy decides not to set up a fire and instead prepare the s'mores without roasting them, and then eats.
immoral_action: Marcy sets up the wood and lights a bonfire at the park to eat the s'mores.

norm: It's wrong to be in a park after closing time.
moral_action: Dan and his friend finish practicing when the park is set to close and go home.
immoral_action: Dan knows the park closes at 7 but stays late on purpose.

norm: It is rude to mow your lawn at midnight.
moral_action: Dave decides that he needs to finish doing his taxes and grabs his files to begin calculating income.
immoral_action: Dave decides that his lawn needs a cut and fires up the John Deere inside the garage causing a loud rumble.

norm: It is foolish to burn down your own house.
moral_action: Tony gets up and adjusts the temperature on the thermostat on his heater.
immoral_action: Tony starts a fire in the living room of his house.

norm: It's wrong to burn down your house.
moral_action: Carlos gets another job and works as many hours as he can.
immoral_action: Carlos sets his house on fire in order to collect the insurance money.

norm: You shouldn't judge others by their weight.
moral_action: Robert hires the most qualified candidate who happens to be overweight.
immoral_action: Robert denies the job to a qualified applicant because she is overweight.

norm: You shouldn't call someone fat.
moral_action: John notices the fan next to him is obese but minds his own business.
immoral_action: Jerry calls a fan sitting next to him fat when they order a plate of food.

norm: You shouldn't judge someone's body weight.
moral_action: Sally sees an overweight boy being made fun of by some girls and tells them to leave him alone.
immoral_action: Sally sees some girls making fun of an overweight boy and joins in and laughs with the others.

norm: You shouldn't call someone's parent fat.
moral_action: Jake tells Paula how much he enjoyed her parents company.
immoral_action: Jake comments on how rotund Paula's father is.

norm: You should not comment on someone's weight.
moral_action: Teri tells Susan that Leah seems alright, but she wishes Leah would talk to her more.
immoral_action: Teri tells Susan that Leah is really chubby so Teri is having a hard time taking her seriously.

norm: You shouldn't call a pregnant woman fat.
moral_action: Christine tells Debbie that she's glowing and looks very good.
immoral_action: Christine tells Debbie that she should be careful about what she's eating, because she's gained quite a lot of weight.

norm: You should not judge the weight of others.
moral_action: Brady tells Pam that he's glad to meet her and looks forward to creating a good working relationship with her.
immoral_action: Brady tells Pam that he cannot take direction from her since her weight makes it obvious she has no self control or discipline.

norm: You shouldn't tell your friend they look fat.
moral_action: Sally replies that she thinks the outfit itself is cute and refrains on commenting on Sara's figure.
immoral_action: Sally replies that the outfit is nice but makes her look overweight.

norm: You shouldn't judge yourself or others based on height.
moral_action: John uses his superior business skills and knowledge to direct people's projects wisely, helping them complete them successfully.
immoral_action: John mounts a ruler on his office door and notes how tall each person is who enters his office, then tries to dominate the taller ones.

norm: You shouldn't make comments about other people's weight.
moral_action: Jenny offers to show the new employee around the building.
immoral_action: Jenny suggests the new employee join her at the company gym to help kick start her weight loss.

norm: It's invasive behavior to Google someone's address.
moral_action: Daryl goes up to Lisa and mentions that he has heard talk of her party.
immoral_action: Daryl doesn't talk to Lisa about her party, and instead decides to just show up after googling her address.

norm: It is controlling to limit a partner's social media use.
moral_action: James tells Lily he feels insecure about her messaging Jack so often.
immoral_action: James complains to Lily whenever she uses social media, often leading to fights.

norm: It's dangerous to mislead people on the internet.
moral_action: Jake listens to the girl and finds ways to show that he understands and respects her.
immoral_action: Jake uses someone else's pictures and tells the girl that he has a high-paying job even though he doesn't.

norm: Blocking someone on social media is hurtful.
moral_action: Ace temporarily mutes the friend, so he can take a breather but still connect later.
immoral_action: Ace blocks the friend, so he doesn't have to see his posts any more.

norm: Social media is expected to be misleading.
moral_action: Matt opens the New York Times website and looks for an article on it.
immoral_action: Matt goes on Facebook and sees his family posting links about the bombing from weird websites.

norm: It's weird to stalk people on the internet.
moral_action: Gary calls his sister and asks him what his sister's interests are.
immoral_action: Gary makes a fake social media profile page, so he can see what his friend's sister is into.

norm: You should never steal someone else's possessions.
moral_action: Heath asks Tom if he can borrow the toy for a few days.
immoral_action: Heath puts the toy in his pocket without telling Tom.

norm: You should not discriminate against anybody because of their disability.
moral_action: Devon asks the woman if she needs any special assistance in using the gym equipment.
immoral_action: Devon walks up to the woman and tells her she must leave due to her disability being a possible liabilty.

norm: Babies should never be treated poorly regardless of their behavior.
moral_action: Nancy changes and feeds the baby getting it back to sleep.
immoral_action: Nancy grabs the baby and hits it to make it stop crying.

norm: You should never scam anyone out of their money
moral_action: Bobby sells his laptop on Craigslist and puts away the money in his bank account.
immoral_action: Bobby decides to sell items on craigslist and and as he is meeting somebody to sell his laptop he snatches the money and drives off.

norm: You should never blame someone else for your mistakes.
moral_action: Tom works extra hours to fix the mistake on his own time and explains it to his boss.
immoral_action: Tom tells his superiors that one of his colleagues, rather than him, was in charge of that part of the project.

norm: You should never be forced into a sexual act.
moral_action: Jane tells John that she doesn't feel comfortable having sex with him and that she wants to go home.
immoral_action: Jane decides to not push saying no to John because she doesn't want to seem uptight.

norm: You should never throw someone else's property away
moral_action: James moves all of his sister's stuff into their garage.
immoral_action: James throws all of his sister's stuff into the trash, so he can move his own stuff in.

norm: You should never threaten to hurt someone physically.
moral_action: Tom asks the other students if he can join in the game with them.
immoral_action: Tom threatens to beat up the other kids if they don't let him play with them.

norm: one should never be demanding.
moral_action: Jake goes to a club to unwind with a nice drink.
immoral_action: Jake insists that Anna should spend some time with him poking her arm several times.

norm: You should never kick a friend out of your home.
moral_action: Chad leads Mark upstairs into his room telling him to rest in bed until he feels better.
immoral_action: Chad tells Mark that he's no longer welcome at the party, and pushes him out of the door.

norm: You should absolutely never steal money from your children
moral_action: Cindy asks Danielle if she can borrow some money and promises to pay her back with interest.
immoral_action: While Danielle is at school, Cindy goes into her room and takes a good chunk from her stash of money.

norm: You should never lie to your parents
moral_action: Craig studies hard, so he can do well on tests and papers to get high grades.
immoral_action: Craig alters his report card to make his grades appear higher than they actually are.

norm: People in position of power should never abuse that power.
moral_action: Alex hires more workers to fulfill the work needed to be done.
immoral_action: Alex tells his workers they will be laid off if they do not work overtime.

norm: people should never deliberately block traffic.
moral_action: Anna waits until they have crossed the road before stopping and explaining why she is unhappy.
immoral_action: Anna stops in the middle of the crosswalk and says she won't move until he apologizes.

norm: You should never make a relative cry.
moral_action: Jill suggests that May talk to her parents and let them know how their fighting affects her.
immoral_action: Jill tells May that it sounds like her parents are having problems and will probably get a divorce.

norm: You should never be racist.
moral_action: With Danielle in the room, Kelly tells Paige that she will be grounded if she does not do her homework, but that Danielle has nothing to do with it.
immoral_action: One day when Danielle is over, Kelly tells Paige that she might be doing better in school if she didn't hang around asian people.

norm: You should never steal.
moral_action: After asking her friend where she bought her lipstick, Macy buys the lipstick at a small store.
immoral_action: Macy takes her friend's lip gloss slipping it into her pocket.

norm: You should never attempt suicide.
moral_action: Ed decides that life isn't so terrible and doesn't jump, walks home, and recommits himself to living life.
immoral_action: Ed decides to jump, climbs the railing, and jumps off of the bridge into the water far below.

norm: You should never hate anyone that is autistic.
moral_action: Jared was upset because Austin broke the rules in a game they were playing.
immoral_action: Jared tells Austin he's upset because Austin is autistic.

norm: You should never bully others.
moral_action: Timmy sees James being picked on and sticks up for him.
immoral_action: Timmy goes up to James and pushes him into the locker to make the other kids think he's cool.

norm: You should never physically attack another person
moral_action: Jasper decides to play a game like Animal Crossing on the computer.
immoral_action: Jasper pushes his brother onto the ground and yanks the Nintendo Switch away from him.

norm: One should never yell at their parents.
moral_action: Benjamin gets out the bills and sits down beside his mother showing her how her shopping habits are harming the house budget.
immoral_action: Benjamin asks her if she has the brains of a fly in a loud tone as he shuts off the computer.

norm: You should never abuse your significant other.
moral_action: Mike sets up a punching bag in the middle of the garage.
immoral_action: Mike gets his wife in a corner and starts to beat her.

norm: It is important to not betray a friend's trust.
moral_action: Paul talks about the recent coronavirus situation.
immoral_action: Paul tells another friend that Sam is uncomfortable with his marriage.

norm: You should be careful not to hit other cars.
moral_action: Glen takes an alternate route to work on back roads hoping that it will be faster.
immoral_action: Glen speeds and drives recklessly in and effort to arrive at work on time.

norm: You should be careful to not bump into others.
moral_action: Jack waits until the crowd disperses and weaves his way through the other runners.
immoral_action: Jack pushes his way through the crowd of runners, jostling other runners as he tried to get ahead.

norm: You should be careful to not spill your food.
moral_action: Lisa drives back to work, eats as much of the slice as she has time for, and runs in for her meeting.
immoral_action: Lisa tries to eat her pizza in the car on the way back to work but hits a bump and drops the slice on her dress.

norm: It is important to not offend others.
moral_action: John asks Eric how long he will be on the computer and says he needs it soon and takes a deep breath.
immoral_action: John confronts Eric and calls him a bunch of bad names in a raised voice.

norm: It's important to not lose your purse.
moral_action: Liz shuts down her game before she gets to her bus stop and double checks that she has all of her things.
immoral_action: Liz keeps playing her game, oblivious to her surroundings, as she departs the bus.

norm: It is moral to prevent theft or stealing
moral_action: Ray reports his friend's website to the FBI so that people stop stealing content.
immoral_action: Ray uses his friend's website and watches as many movies as he can.

norm: It is important to not ignore responsibilities for games.
moral_action: Marc pauses his game and cleans his house to prepare for his guests, he then resumes and plays while his guests watch.
immoral_action: Marc continues playing his video game up until the moment his guests arrive, letting them see his messy house and kitchen full of dirt dishes.

norm: You shouldn't tell someone they'll never find love.
moral_action: Mario tells Fred there is someone for everyone and counsels Fred to be more careful who he hands his heart to.
immoral_action: Mario tells Fred all women will ever do is use him and tells Fred he should use them back.

norm: You shouldn't marry someone you never met.
moral_action: Glenda tells Clark that he needs to ask her out on a date first, and then they'll see.
immoral_action: Glenda tells Clark that he is ruggedly handsome so of course she accepts the marriage proposal.

norm: It's not okay to of never of met your children.
moral_action: Ernest tells his wife that his son wants to connect and asks what she would be comfortable with.
immoral_action: Ernest does not attempt to respond to his son's requests to meet and does not tell his wife.

norm: It's never okay to cheat on your significant other.
moral_action: Maggie goes to the concert and ignores any guy that tries to flirt with her.
immoral_action: Maggie goes to the concert and ends up making out with a guy after a few drinks.

norm: Not talking to a parent will never mend the relationship.
moral_action: David starts speaking with his father again and slowly repairs their relationship.
immoral_action: David decides to avoid speaking with his father again and ignores any contact attempts from his father.

norm: You can't expect your parents to always keep their promises.
moral_action: Roy decides to wait until a better time in order to ask for the gift.
immoral_action: Roy brings up the promise when he finds out his parents weren't able to buy the console.

norm: You are not supposed to mother your partner.
moral_action: Dani lets her husband do whatever he wants but lets him know her opinions.
immoral_action: Dani refuses to let her husband drink any alcohol anymore.

norm: It's important to keep an eye on your child.
moral_action: Molly takes turns with another mother watching each other's kids.
immoral_action: Molly starts reading and ignores her child while they are playing.

norm: You should try to instill some confidence in your children.
moral_action: Brad tells Tim that he is smart and capable, to keep trying his best and the results will follow.
immoral_action: Brad scolds Tim for his poor grade and threatens to ground him if his scores don't improve.

norm: You should keep an eye on your children.
moral_action: Tori asks her kids to pause the game while she runs inside and watches them from the window as she takes her call.
immoral_action: Leaving her kids to play, Tori runs inside to answer the phone.

norm: You should be patient with children.
moral_action: Remy creates a reward system for students in the course who are especially quiet and attentive.
immoral_action: Remy whistles loudly and tells the children he will cancel the class entirely if they don't listen to him.

norm: It's expected that you help children.
moral_action: Wanda gives the girl directions to her classroom and then continues walking down the hallway.
immoral_action: Wanda continues walking down the hallway to her classroom, ignoring the girl.

norm: You're expected to encourage children in their endeavors.
moral_action: Christine was patient with her daughter as she tried to gain balance and ride her bike, each time she fell Christine encouraged her to get back on and try again.
immoral_action: Christine watched her daughter try to ride, but she became frustrated when she kept falling and was critical of how hard she was trying.

norm: You should help out your child when they need you.
moral_action: Lizzy wraps herself in a towel and rushes to her son's room, deciding to rinse off after she finds out what is wrong.
immoral_action: Lizzy continues her shower for another ten minutes before checking on her son.

norm: You should do things with your kids.
moral_action: John calls his friends and tells them he'll be late to the bar and takes his kids first to bowling.
immoral_action: John pretends he doesn't see his kids and rushes out to the bar with his friends.

norm: Spoiling movies for people could make them angry at you.
moral_action: Mark enjoys watching his friend's reactions to the plot twists in the movie.
immoral_action: Mark announces the ending halfway through the movie in his excitement.

norm: It's cruel to make people think you're shooting at them
moral_action: Larry tells his friend a joke to make them laugh.
immoral_action: Larry holds the gun out the window and pretends to shoot at people.

norm: It's wrong to bully someone just because they bullied you.
moral_action: John speaks to the coach about his problems with the team captain to ask the coach to intervene.
immoral_action: John starts making fun of the team captain and getting other teammates to do the same.

norm: People will think you're a bully if you harass others.
moral_action: Roberto befriends one of the other guys, and they take turns telling jokes to the girls.
immoral_action: Roberto starts calling out of the other guys shortcomings in front of the girls.

norm: It's sad to see a student being bullied by another.
moral_action: Case gets upset, walks up to the bully, and tells him to stop picking on the other student or else.
immoral_action: Case laughs at the bullied kid and cheers the bully on.

norm: It's hurtful to make fun of your classmates.
moral_action: Jim tells his classmate the right answer and offers to help him after school.
immoral_action: Jim starts to laugh at his classmate and tells him he is stupid for not knowing the answer.

norm: People will think you're a creep if you stalk people.
moral_action: Jimmy talks to his friend about his sister and tells him that he likes her.
immoral_action: Every time Jimmy sees the girl talking, he stands near her to hear what she's saying.

norm: It's bad to bully others just because they bullied you.
moral_action: Jake tells Ray that he won't let him bully him, but he's moving on and won't take revenge against Ray.
immoral_action: Jake tells Ray that Ray will be doing whatever Jake says from now on.

norm: It's mean to bully your classmates.
moral_action: Steve tells a joke that he saw on Reddit the morning of.
immoral_action: Steve makes a joke at Billy's expense, making fun of how he looks.

norm: It's mean to taunt your classmates at school.
moral_action: Stella asks Sally if she wants to hang out after school.
immoral_action: Stella teases Sally constantly about the clothes she wears to class.

norm: It's expected that you'll help your coworkers.
moral_action: Sammy stays back and helps the coworker with the presentation.
immoral_action: Sammy blows off the coworker to go to dinner with her boyfriend.

norm: You should try to get along with your coworkers
moral_action: Bob explains that the radio is making work difficult for Bob and asks his coworker to turn it down or wear headphones.
immoral_action: Bob yells at his coworker to turn off their radio and threatens to make a complaint to the boss.

norm: You should tell people about the life you've lived.
moral_action: Tom says that he did commit a crime, but has been rehabilitated.
immoral_action: Tom says that he has never committed a crime and hands the application in.

norm: You should get to know people for their personalities.
moral_action: Randy engages with Jennifer and asks about her interests, history, likes and dislikes.
immoral_action: Randy lets Jennifer know that she has the exact type of boobs and butt that he looks for in a woman.

norm: You should help out your classmates.
moral_action: Jill says she will spend some time explaining the questions in the math homework to her classmate.
immoral_action: Jill says she doesn't have the time or energy to help her classmate as she has her own homework to do.

norm: You should learn to work together with others.

immoral_action: Trevor tries to fill up all the boxes with produce and other food items by himself.

norm: It's expected that co-workers should look out for one another.
moral_action: Colin does his work along with Jace's in order to keep the both of them from being criticized by their boss.
immoral_action: Colin only does his work so that his boss isn't suspicious of anything that he's doing.

norm: You should help out your coworkers if they need help.
moral_action: Hilda tells Tina how to use the printer.
immoral_action: Hilda tells Tina that she should search online if she wants to know how to use the printer.

norm: You should help out customers if you work there.
moral_action: Tommy tells the customer that he doesn't know, but he asks another worker, and they find out where the book is.
immoral_action: Tommy truthfully tells the customer that he doesn't know but doesn't try to find out where it is.

norm: It is expected that you help and support coworkers
moral_action: James argues with his boss and says they should bill the clients for some temps to come help out.
immoral_action: James calls in sick on Saturday because he doesn't want to deal with the workload.

norm: It's good to buy things to support your local events.
moral_action: Dan chats with the people with booths as he buys from them.
immoral_action: Dan walks around focusing on mingling rather than buying anything.

norm: It's good to patronize your local stores.
moral_action: Mario goes to a local hardware store in his neighborhood to buy his tools.
immoral_action: Mario goes to buy his tools at a large retail store where he can get them for a low price.

norm: It's good to support someone's business.
moral_action: Becky goes to her usual stylist at the salon.
immoral_action: Becky decides to skip going to her usual salon and save some money by cutting her own hair.

norm: It's good to super your local businesses.
moral_action: Victor decides to shop at local shops for his ingredients even if it means an extra stop or two.
immoral_action: Victor drives past the locally own shops and goes to the supermarket, so he can get everything in one stop.

norm: It's good to support businesses on campus.
moral_action: James stops at the sandwich shop and buys a roast beef sandwich and chips for $10.
immoral_action: James walks to the Subway across the street from his college campus.

norm: It's good to support local businesses.
moral_action: Jeff drives to the farmer's market in town and buys a few apples.
immoral_action: Jeff goes to the national chain grocery store and buys a bag of apples.

norm: It's good to share with your roommate.
moral_action: Sky offers the food to Amber and the two of them look up how to preserve it to make it last much longer than the expiration dates.
immoral_action: Sky binges on all of the food at once after smoking a lot of marijuana to make sure none of it goes bad.

norm: It's good to share duties with your roommates.
moral_action: Carrie asks her roommates if they can clean up for her tonight, and she will return the favor later, so that she can leave on time.
immoral_action: Carrie leaves all her mess and dirty dishes in the kitchen, so she can leave early.

norm: It's good to respect your roommate's space.
moral_action: Trevor waits until his roommate gets home and asks to borrow the book, and they give it to Trevor.
immoral_action: Trevor goes into his roommate's room and goes through their things until he finds the book he wants.

norm: It's kind to help a roommate in need.
moral_action: John offers to drive Eric to the store, goes to the movie and picks Eric from the store when it's over.
immoral_action: John ignores Eric's needs and takes the only car to the movie theatre.

norm: It's good to do favors for your roommates.
moral_action: John gets up and does the dishes and vacuums the floor so Bob has less to do.
immoral_action: John tells Bob he should quiet down while cleaning, because John is trying to play video games.

norm: It's good to communicate your feelings with your roommate.
moral_action: Keara talks to her roommate and points out how messy the place looks.
immoral_action: Keara decides to clean up the mess that her roommate has made herself.

norm: It is positive to attempt to quit smoking
moral_action: Amy decides to take an unproven supplement that claims to counteract the negative effects of smoking.
immoral_action: Amy enters a smoking cessation program and is able to stop smoking cigarettes.

norm: It's good to cancel plans when you're ill.
moral_action: Sue calls Sam to cancel lunch, explaining that she's got a fever and other symptoms.
immoral_action: Sue texts Sam and says she will be a little late before getting showered and ready to go.

norm: It's good to cut yourself out of drama at work.
moral_action: Tom is asked how he feels about another coworker and says he'd prefer to stay out of the conversation.
immoral_action: Tom overhears some gossip and spreads it to others, thinking it will make him look favorable.

norm: It's fine to take off work if you're sick.
moral_action: Felicity calls her boss to tell him she won't be in because she's sick and asks if someone can finish her report.
immoral_action: Felicity goes to work sick to finish working on her report.

norm: It's reasonable to be happy when classes are cancelled.
moral_action: Kyle asks his friend if they would like to hang out since there are no classes.
immoral_action: Kyle is upset about the cancellation because he was hoping to do a lot of class work, so he immediately starts studying on his own.

norm: It's good to give up an unhealthy habit.
moral_action: Fabio meditates for an hour before redoing his resume.
immoral_action: Fabio orders five meals from McDonalds.

norm: It's good to end a toxic relationship
moral_action: Tim decides to split with Amy and agrees to split time watching the kids.
immoral_action: Tim decided it would be better to stay in the relationship.

norm: It's good to get divorced if you're unhappy.
moral_action: Freya decides to divorce Nathan and find a partner she can be happy with because she believes the kids should not have unhappy parents.
immoral_action: Freya decides to stay with Nathan to provide stability for the kids because she believes that will best for them.

norm: It's good to quit drinking if you have a problem.
moral_action: Bev decides to not drink and to sleep extra.
immoral_action: Bev drinks a fair amount.

norm: You shouldn't copy papers online for your class.
moral_action: Dave reads the information again to make sure he understands and then rewrites it in his own words but also cites his reference as being the website.
immoral_action: Dave highlights the parts that he likes in the website and copies and pastes them into his report.

norm: People shouldn't go to college just to party.
moral_action: Bob socializes with other students from his intended major.
immoral_action: Bob joins a frat and parties hard with his new fraternity brothers almost every night.

norm: You shouldn't use your cell phone in class.
moral_action: Sypha lets the phone vibrate, so they can leave a message she'll check later.
immoral_action: Sypha answers the phone and talks on it while she's studying.

norm: You shouldn't go to college parties if you're underage.
moral_action: Max and his roommates hang out in their dorm room and play video games.
immoral_action: Max and his roommates go to a nearby frat party and start partying and drinking.

norm: You shouldn't ask someone if they are a school shooter.
moral_action: James asks his lab partner what kind of hobbies he has as an ice breaker.
immoral_action: James asks his lab partner if he would ever consider shooting up the school.

norm: You shouldn't try to get out of going to school.
moral_action: Barbara tells her mom she can go to school because the stomach ache isn't bad.
immoral_action: Barbara tells her mom she won't be going to school because of the stomach ache.

norm: You shouldn't bring alcohol to your school prom.
moral_action: Simon buys a small personal gift for each of his friends.
immoral_action: Simon sneaks a flask of vodka in, for he and his friends to share.

norm: You shouldn't ask someone else's boyfriend to prom.
moral_action: Kelsi asks one of the other guys in the group to go to the prom with her.
immoral_action: Kelsi asks her friend's boyfriend if he wants to go to the prom with her.

norm: You shouldn't bring weapons to school.
moral_action: Tyler brings s skateboard with him to school and performs tricks on it for his friends.

norm: It is good to try in school.

moral_action: Terry tells his friends a very amusing story.
immoral_action: Terry grabs a nearby garbage can and empties the content out on his own head.

norm: You shouldn't always assume people are faking their depression.

immoral_action: Howard ignores Eric's mood and thinks that he just wants attention.

norm: You aren't expected to solve everyone else's problems.

immoral_action: Joe tells her not to worry and gives her money for groceries.

norm: People shouldn't constantly look to trade up on relationships.
moral_action: Emily decides that making money herself is better than dating a rich guy, and she lands a well-paying job.
immoral_action: Emily just ditched her boyfriend for someone richer, after doing the same thing last year.

norm: You shouldn't always expect your friends to help you out.
moral_action: Steve calls a mobile repair service and asks them to come out and help him.
immoral_action: Steve calls his mechanic friend and asks him to come out and fix his car.

norm: It's polite to give someone advice when they request it.

immoral_action: Bill tells Jenny that he doesn't really have any advice one way or the other as Jenny is only a friend and not a client.

norm: It's polite to share duties.

immoral_action: Wang leaves without telling his brother, and without doing the chores.

norm: It is polite to thank others.
moral_action: John tells Andi that it's wonderful and thanks her for going through the trouble of getting the gift.
immoral_action: John tells Andi that the watch isn't quite the type he likes and that he'll probably end up returning or exchanging it.

norm: It's polite to give warnings.
moral_action: "Jeff puts out ""wet floor"" signs throughout the store and begins his mopping."
immoral_action: "Jeff mops the floor but does not put up a ""wet floor"" sign."

norm: It's polite to inform people of your plans.
moral_action: Boris lets their boss know they need to take an hour to go to an interview.
immoral_action: Boris leaves work without telling anyone to attend his interview.

norm: It's courteous to learn how to behave around others.
moral_action: Donald reads up on proper dining etiquette and practices it, then goes to the dinner.
immoral_action: Donald decides that they'll love him for who he is and goes without any etiquette training.

norm: It's polite to abide by others' schedules.
moral_action: Jennifer asks her husband when his lunch break is and then schedules the meeting for that time.
immoral_action: Jennifer schedules the appointment for the time that suits her best without consulting with her husband first.

norm: It's polite to want others follow their dreams
moral_action: Ted tells his son that he'll support whatever career decision that he decides to make.
immoral_action: Ted tells his son that he's going to be seen as a loser if he becomes a garbageman.

norm: It is appropriate to dress modestly.
moral_action: Jenna chooses to wear an elegant dress which is not too revealing.
immoral_action: Jenna chooses to wear a pretty, but very lowcut dress.

norm: Punctuality is considered to be polite.
moral_action: Bill rushes to the meeting, arriving with time to spare to brew himself a mug of coffee at the office kitchen.
immoral_action: Bill stops off at a coffee shop to pick up a coffee to take with him to the meeting.

norm: It's polite to hold the door open for people.
moral_action: Paul opens the door and holds it open behind him for the stranger.
immoral_action: Paul quickly opens the door to get out of the elements and steps inside.

norm: It's courteous to wear clean clothing
moral_action: Harry put on a nice suit and tie to attend his friend's wedding reception.
immoral_action: Harry puts on a stained tee shirt and blue jeans to attend the reception.

norm: It is polite to follow simple rule of etiquette.
moral_action: Lisa chooses the correct fork to eat eat course of her dinner with.
immoral_action: Lisa eats the spaghetti on her plate using nothing but her fingers.

norm: It's polite to confirm an appointment.
moral_action: Fred calls the realtor, the week before the scheduled meeting, to remind them of the specific business that he intends to conduct.
immoral_action: Fred prepares the appropriate documents for the business he wants to conduct and drives over to the realty office.

norm: It's polite to choose your words carefully around others.

immoral_action: Ryan asks Nina if she's looked in a mirror lately, ssaying the haircut is not very good.

norm: It's polite to offer your services to others.

immoral_action: Kerry passes by Lisa without giving a thought to offering her a ride.

norm: It's polite to use somebody's name when talking to them
moral_action: Ian quickly glances at Frank's name tag in order to remember Frank's name before calling for him by name.
immoral_action: Ian shouts hey you to get Frank's attention, and repeats the phrase until Frank looks up at him.

norm: It's polite to ask people how they're doing.

immoral_action: Doug gets right into talking about football and food.

norm: It's polite to be considerate of others in a conversation.

immoral_action: Sam tells Taylor about the restaurant he's going to for dinner, talking over her every time she tries to interject something.

norm: You shouldn't ignore people that are ill.

immoral_action: Jane calls up some friends and arranges a night out with them, so she can get out of the house.

norm: You shouldn't lie about being molested.

immoral_action: Tom tells his parents he was molested and says he doesn't want to go to school.

norm: You shouldn't lie about being mugged.
moral_action: Jimmy confesses to his mom about what he did and sincerly apologiizes.
immoral_action: Jimmy tells his mom that he was mugged by a tall black male on his way to the store.

norm: You shouldn't lie about who farted.
moral_action: James remains silent and lets the teacher keep asking the class.
immoral_action: James blames his friend, who's sitting next to him.

norm: You shouldn't lie about having migraines.

immoral_action: Peter says that he has a migraine even though he feels fine.

norm: You shouldn't lie about having insomnia.

immoral_action: Josie tells her RA she has insomnia to get a suite with a bathroom.

norm: You shouldn't hate someone for getting sick a lot.

immoral_action: Rachel detests the employee thinking they are lazy and switches her schedule.

norm: You shouldn't lie and tell people you have a cold.

immoral_action: Tanya tells her friends she can't make it because she's feeling ill.

norm: You shouldn't ignore someone who is suicidal.

immoral_action: Gary ignores the text because he thinks Don is just being overly dramatic.

norm: You shouldn't lie about being sober.

immoral_action: Lisa keeps attending the meetings, but she drinks both before and after each one of them.

norm: You shouldn't lie about having an addiction.

immoral_action: Fred tells Alan he only drinks a little bit and he is fine.

norm: You shouldn't lie about having a medical condition.

immoral_action: Melissa tells Marge that she has diabetes;therefore, eating the cupcake would make her sick.

norm: You shouldn't refuse to see the doctor if you're sick.
moral_action: Andre makes an appointment and goes to visit his family doctor.
immoral_action: Andre decides to treat his illness himself with soup and aspirin.

norm: You shouldn't deny others and their medical diagnosis's.
moral_action: Grant serves nice steaks.
immoral_action: Grant serves lobsters even though he knows about Erin's allergy.

norm: You shouldn't lie about being sick.
moral_action: Rick uses some of his personal time off for a day off.
immoral_action: Rick calls in and tells his boss that he is sick.

norm: You shouldn't lie about your health.
moral_action: Linda calls her office and tells her boss that, while she is not physically sick, she really needs a vacation day.
immoral_action: Linda calls into her office and tells her boss that she is feeling sick and won't make it to work that day.

norm: You shouldn't lie to your friends about being ill.

immoral_action: Sawyer tells his friends that he is sick with the flu.

norm: You shouldn't be rude to your doctor.

immoral_action: When Brenda see her doctor she tells him that she's tired, long waits are unacceptable, and he doesn't run his office well.

norm: You shouldn't hide important medical issues from your loved ones.

immoral_action: Ray delays telling his son as long as possible, so he continues his schooling.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone's medication.
moral_action: Dana goes to a local doctor explaining the situation, who prescribes her limited Oxycontin supply.
immoral_action: Dana decides to sneak into a pharmacy and take a few pills that were meant for other patients.

norm: You shouldn't be pushy with people with medical conditions.

immoral_action: Gayle orders a large lunch buffet for her sales rep during their 30 minute lunch, but rudely rushes a handicapped sales rep through the line.

norm: You shouldn't hide your medical conditions from others.
moral_action: Jackie tells the club that she has asthma and needs to find suitable activities, so they go see a movie.
immoral_action: Jackie doesn't tell the club that she has asthma, and they take her on a hike with them.

norm: You shouldn't lie to people about having a disease.

immoral_action: Jarold tells everyone he has cancer in order to get some donations.

norm: Trivializing people's depression is rude.
moral_action: John tells Mary that depression is a serious health issue that requires expert assistance and offers to help Mary find a therapist.
immoral_action: "John tells Mary that depression is easily cured by ""Simply cheering up"" and tells her not to look so glum."

norm: Giving your friends the silent treatment is immature behavior.
moral_action: Ash sits down with the friend and explains why it made her so angry.
immoral_action: Ash decides not to talk to her friend for several weeks.

norm: It's discouraged to become so inebriated you black out.
moral_action: Matt tries a beer a day after work.
immoral_action: Matt drinks them all that evening over a five hour period.

norm: It's mean to ignore suicidal people.

immoral_action: Jake decides to ignore the text and go to sleep.

norm: Avoiding someone just because they're sad makes you appear shallow.

immoral_action: Philip decides to hang out with other friends instead in order to avoid his best friend's depressing mood.

norm: Not helping an injured kid makes you look cowardly.

immoral_action: Kyle turns and walks in the other direction lest he have to actually do something for the kid.

norm: Making someone feel bad when they just lost is rude.

norm: Letting people know that you never liked them is mean.

immoral_action: Kevin tells Paul that he never really enjoyed his company, and he tells him to leave.

norm: Avoiding helping your friend can be seen as disloyal.

immoral_action: Tim keeps making up reasons for why he doesn't have time to meet his friends and help them study.

norm: You shouldn't aspire to do well just to gloat.

immoral_action: Lisa works hard in her studies and work so that she may one day rub her sisters face in her success.

norm: It's mean to not take depression seriously.

immoral_action: James tries to make a joke about how having depression is at least better than having herpes.

norm: It is good to respect other people's space.

norm: It's good to respect the privacy of others.

norm: It is good to care for other living things.

norm: It's good to be quiet around others.

norm: It is good to keep some space.

immoral_action: Hank squishes the television in the car on top of other stuff.

norm: It's good to maintain your privacy.

immoral_action: Lindsey posts all about her upcoming vacation and when she will be gone.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone else's phone.

norm: You shouldn't break up over text messages.

norm: You shouldn't give out someone's phone number without permission.

norm: You shouldn't pig out on candy.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone's wallet.

norm: You should not steal money to buy a skateboard.

norm: You shouldn't throw out someone else's mail.

norm: You shouldn't throw away anyone else's mail.

norm: You shouldn't force your phone number onto someone else.

norm: You shouldn't use your friend's phone without their permission.

norm: You shouldn't steal candy from kids.

norm: You shouldn't give a fake credit card to people.

norm: You shouldn't block people on your partner's phone.

norm: You shouldn't steal someone's credit card.

norm: You shouldn't break up with someone via text message.

immoral_action: Ian lacks the courage to communicate which caused the problems to begin with, so he sends a text about to his partner informing them the relationship is over.

norm: It's bad to buy things you can't afford.

norm: It's bad to keep money that isn't rightfully yours.

norm: It is bad to use money intended for someone else.

immoral_action: Ned buys the candy bar along with the Advil with his mom's money and doesn't give any cash back to his mom.

norm: It's bad to spend money you don't have.

immoral_action: Borg figures he can spend $100 and can make up for it with extra work.

norm: It's hurtful to take money from the disadvantaged.

norm: It's bad to do illegal things to make money.

immoral_action: Sally fills the cart with extra items that are in addition to the things her mother-in-law authorized her to buy with her credit card.

norm: It's bad to be stingy with your money.

norm: It's bad to gamble away too much money.

immoral_action: Jackie wins a few games of roulette and then gets greedy and bets everything she has.

norm: It's bad to be competitive over buying gifts.

norm: It's bad to fall behind on bills.

norm: It's bad to engage in credit card fraud.

immoral_action: Johanna uses stolen credit cards to order school books online.

norm: It's bad to owe money.

norm: It's embarrassing to have to beg for money.

norm: It's bad to commit robbery.

norm: It is bad to take advantage of people for money.

immoral_action: Chantelle tells her friends she is collecting money for charity and uses it for her rent.

norm: It's bad to buy a car you can't afford

immoral_action: Christian purchases a top-of-the-line car that is out of his price range.

norm: It's bad to steal money.

immoral_action: One day at work when no one is around, Trevor takes money out of a medical charity's donation cup.

norm: It is bad to care about only money in life.

norm: It's bad to buy expensive things you can't afford

immoral_action: Jessie goes to the car dealership and buys a luxury car that she can't afford.

norm: It is bad to keep money from others.

immoral_action: Gloria opens an oversea bank account to save up her money and no one knows about it, and she doesn't intend to help Alice.

norm: It's bad to run up a high phone bill.

norm: It's bad to buy more unnecessary junk you don't need.

norm: Running up a debt on a credit card is dangerous.

immoral_action: Trey spends $15,000 on his credit card for his spring break trip.

norm: It's good to look one's best at work.

immoral_action: Monica decides to keep driving since turning around will make her late for work.

norm: It's good to use your time efficiently.

norm: It is good to perfect a craft.

immoral_action: Dave says that he won't practice today as he just cannot find the time nor energy.

norm: It's good to take responsibility at work.

immoral_action: Jeff starts showing up to work dressed like a slob.

norm: It's good to be responsible and work.

immoral_action: Jay volunteers for an extra shift but spends it playing on his cell phone.

norm: It's good to care about your performance at work.

norm: It is good to look for jobs.

norm: It's marvelous to make someone's day with a simple call.

norm: It's good to handle your business in an expedient manner.

norm: It's good to stand up for yourself at work.

immoral_action: Michelle apologizes for her performance but does not tell her boss about her co-worker's behavior.

norm: It's good to move up in your job.

norm: It's good to have a job.

norm: It's good to be employed in a full time job.

immoral_action: Carla works at her friends temporary agency.

norm: It's good to sharpen your craft

immoral_action: John decides the programming course is not worth his time and does not sign up for it.

norm: It's good to do chores on time.

norm: It's good to want to work.

norm: It is good to get your work done.

norm: It's good to care about your work.

immoral_action: Todd decides that it is too time consuming to go back over his work from earlier, so he just leaves it in its unacceptable state.

norm: It is good to look for work.

immoral_action: David threatens his landlord into letting him stay at his house for free.

norm: It's bad to let friends drive drunk.

immoral_action: Jane lets her friend drive her car home.

norm: It's frowned upon to get drunk.

immoral_action: Tim drinks too much and gets drunk to the point of almost blacking out.

norm: It's bad to drink alcohol to excess.

immoral_action: Jerry drinks one shot after another of tequila.

norm: It's bad to stop taking your prescriptions.

immoral_action: Alistair goes off their medication.

norm: It's bad to get too drunk.

norm: It's bad to be an alcoholic.

immoral_action: Lin buys a personal pan pizza which is only enough for one person.

norm: You shouldn't care about how much someone eats.
moral_action: Oscar offers to start an exercise routine with Tom to get in better shape.
immoral_action: Oscar tells Tom that he needs to cut down on how much food he eats, so he doesn't die.

norm: You shouldn't take someone's food.
moral_action: Chris sees James step away for a moment but waits for him to come back to ask to have some fries.
immoral_action: Chris notices that James walked away for a moment and takes his french fries.

norm: It's frowned upon to refuse food that someone offers.
moral_action: Brad accepts a cookie and goes for a run later to make up for it.
immoral_action: Brad pushes the cookie away and refuses to eat it.

norm: You shouldn't eat food off the ground.
moral_action: Bart asks his waitress if she could bring him another plate.
immoral_action: Bart gets on the floor and eats the food off of the ground.

norm: You should not fry everything you eat.
moral_action: Mickey starts eating more raw vegetables and fruits, and only cooks his food a few times a week until he gets an oven.
immoral_action: Mickey decides that his lethargy has nothing to do with his food, so he doesn't make any changes to his diet.

norm: You shouldn't play with your food.
moral_action: Cameron takes a bite of mashed potatoes and uses his napkin to clean up his face.
immoral_action: Cameron takes a bite of mashed potatoes and has it erupt out of his mouth like a volcano.

norm: You shouldn't let someone eat your food.
moral_action: James secretly installs a camera in the kitchen to catch the person taking his food.
immoral_action: James starts buying twice as many frozen dinners at the grocery store each week.

norm: It's wrong not to show up for an appointment.
moral_action: Jane picks out an outfit the day before the presentation and gets there early enough to prepare.
immoral_action: Jane spends so much time picking out an outfit, she misses the presentation entirely.

norm: It's wrong to complain all the time.
moral_action: Connie says how grateful she is for her job and her friends.
immoral_action: Connie complains about her job, her boss, and the company during the whole lunch break.

norm: It's rude not to open the door to somebody
moral_action: John smiles and holds the door open for the stranger.
immoral_action: "John says ""no"" and lets the door swing closed."

norm: It is unprofessional to forget when you have an appointment.
moral_action: Marnie sets a reminder on her phone for the meeting.
immoral_action: Marnie gets so wrapped up in her work that she forgets to go to the vendor meeting.

norm: It's rude not to keep a scheduled appointment.
moral_action: Ari tells his friend that he has a meeting and makes plans to go rock climbing once he's done.
immoral_action: Ari goes rock climbing with his friend and skips the meeting.

norm: It's rude to expect people to always give you rides.
moral_action: Xavier starts walking and sticks his thumb out as people pass by.
immoral_action: Xavier stands by the side of the road and attempts to jump into the first pick-up truck he sees.

norm: It's unprofessional to be late to work.
moral_action: Jane schedules her appointment with the doctor for 8:00 and informs her manager in case it runs late.
immoral_action: Jane schedules the appointment with her doctor at 9:00 without informing anyone at work.

norm: It's not nice to expect others to wait for you
moral_action: Jenna goes directly to meet her friends and asks them if she can sleep in the backseat of their car.
immoral_action: Jenna falls back asleep in her bed and arrives to the meeting point an hour late.

norm: It's rude to expect others to always include you.
moral_action: Dana tells Mindy she should have fun on the date.
immoral_action: Dana says that she should have been invited on Mindy's date.

norm: It's wrong to mooch off other people all the time.
moral_action: Jackie hands her card to the waitress before Jared can respond.
immoral_action: Jackie tells Jared to  put the meal on his credit card.

norm: It's rude to have someone wait for you.
moral_action: Steve gets something to eat at the cafe in the library.
immoral_action: Steve stops at a pizzeria on the way to the library.

norm: It's rude not to hold the door for other people.
moral_action: Jim opens the door, steps aside for the man on crutches to enter, then walks inside the bank.
immoral_action: Jim opens the door and walks inside the bank.

norm: It's impolite not to open the door for someone.
moral_action: Barry opens the door for himself and holds it open for Sally to go through.
immoral_action: Barry opens the door for himself and lets it close behind him.

norm: It is rude to complain about waiting.
moral_action: Rachael plays games on her cellphone until her food arrives.
immoral_action: Rachael passes time by making comments about the wait time to the person sitting near her.

norm: It's rude to keep other people waiting for you
moral_action: Utari drives to the meeting place, and reads his favorite book while he waits for his client.
immoral_action: Utari continues playing Overwatch until he reaches a stopping point.

norm: It's disrespectful to keep people waiting
moral_action: Jeremy leaves early to eat first then meets with his friends.
immoral_action: Jeremy gets something to eat right before he has to meet with his friends.

norm: You shouldn't yell at your teachers.
moral_action: John apologizes to the teacher for being distracted during class and distracting others as well.
immoral_action: John screams at the teacher to give his note back to him, that it's his and that she's mean and unfair.

norm: You shouldn't swear at your teachers.
moral_action: Jordan coughs loudly and says his teacher's name to get her attention.
immoral_action: Jordan gets up, calls his teacher a bitch, and tells her he has to use the bathroom.

norm: You shouldn't tell your classmate to shut up.
moral_action: Edward waits for Mary to finish speaking, then adds the corrections to her information as bullet points on the board beside the presentation.
immoral_action: Edward interjects while Mary is speaking and tells her to shut up, then supplying the audience with the correct information.

norm: You shouldn't tell your parents to shut up.
moral_action: Emma put in her bluetooth headphones and turned up the volume of the music.
immoral_action: Emma told her parents they need to pipe down, so she could hear better.

norm: You shouldn't give your students mean looks.
moral_action: Mrs. Smith puts Jimmy's test on his desk and asks to speak to him about his performance after the bell.
immoral_action: Mrs. Smith puts Jimmy's test down on his desk and gives him a mean look full of spite and disappointment.

norm: You shouldn't humiliate your professors.
moral_action: Bruce asks the professor a clarifying question, giving the professor a chance to catch his mistake.
immoral_action: Bruce interrupts the lecture to tell the rest of the class that the professor made a simple mistake that anyone should have noticed.

norm: You shouldn't let someone quit school.
moral_action: Jon, Billy and the school guidance counselor sit down and have a long discussion.
immoral_action: Jon signs Billy out of school after Billy begs him to do it.

norm: It's good to offer to tutor people.
moral_action: Trent offers to help Jake understand the topic.
immoral_action: Trent directs Jake to a math tutoring website.

norm: It's good to award your students for their efforts.
moral_action: Mr.Brown throws pizza parties for his students when they reach major milestones.
immoral_action: Mr.Brown assigns heavy work on a daily basis without ever commending his students for doing their part.

norm: It is good to encourage students.
moral_action: Mary sets up mentoring sessions for the struggling student where they receive encouragement and tutoring.
immoral_action: Mary tells the student's parents that their child is doing okay and inflates the student's grade to avoid conflict.

norm: It's good to study with your friends.
moral_action: Fred asks George to study with him, and they spend the rest of the evening going over notes together.
immoral_action: Fred studies his math notes by himself at home that evening.

norm: It's good to be supportive of your classmates.
moral_action: James congratulates all his classmates who are on the football team.
immoral_action: James plays with his phone while everyone else is congratulating the football team.

norm: It's good to help your classmates out.
moral_action: Rudy sits closer to the classmate so that they can copy his notes easier.
immoral_action: Rudy tells his classmate to get some glasses, so he can take his own notes.

norm: It's good to mentor students.
moral_action: Anna starts mentoring students by spending time with them after school to impress the boss.
immoral_action: Anna enrolls in classes, so she can further her education to impress the boss, so she must leave right after class each day.

norm: It's wrong to verbally abuse your mother.
moral_action: Steve asks his mom to talk and explains how he feels that the amount of work is unfair.
immoral_action: Steve swears at his mother and calls her stupid.

norm: It's considered inappropriate to yell at your own mother.
moral_action: Alan talks to his mother calmly and decides to install safety locks for the stove.
immoral_action: Alan gets angry and yells at his mother not to leave the stove on.

norm: It's wrong to harm your mother.
moral_action: Jessie kindly asks Mary to stop opening her packages and threatens to move out if she continues.
immoral_action: Jessie catches Mary with one of her packages and pushes her.

norm: It is wrong to do anything that hurts your wife.
moral_action: Danny suggests that they play a fun card game.
immoral_action: Danny pranks Diane in front of their friends.

norm: It's wrong to lie to your family about your pregnancy.
moral_action: Joan tells her parents she is pregnant and lays out rules they must follow to have a relationship with their grandchild.
immoral_action: Joan decides to hide her pregnancy from her parents for as long as she can.

norm: It's wrong to call your mom stupid.
moral_action: Charles reads the instruction manual with his mother explaining all the technical terms to her.
immoral_action: Charles configures the TV while he compares his mother's intelligence to a two year old.

norm: It is wrong to force your daughter to marry.
moral_action: Steve tells his daughter how important seeing her married is to him.
immoral_action: Steve pressures his daughter into marrying her abusive boyfriend.

norm: It is wrong to neglect your pregnant wife.
moral_action: John tends to his wife's needs, takes her to the hospital and waits for her to give birth before going out with friends.
immoral_action: John ignores her and goes bar-hopping.

norm: It's wrong to hit your wife.
moral_action: Brad lets his wife know that he is throwing the shirt because of the burn marks.
immoral_action: Brad shows the shirt to his wife and then slaps her across the face for burning it.

norm: It is wrong to steal a ring from your mom.
moral_action: Marlon gets a job and earns money to buy a ring for his girlfriend.
immoral_action: Marlon finds a ring in his mom's jewelry box and takes it to give to his girlfriend.

norm: It's wrong to disrespect a person's mother.
moral_action: Clayton recites an inspirational quote and offers to help Maurice study.
immoral_action: Clayton makes a silly impersonation of Maurice's parents.

norm: It's wrong to make a new wife feel unwelcome
moral_action: Rick tells his son and his wife that their marriage will have ups and downs but as long as their love is strong their future will be great.
immoral_action: Rick tells his son and his wife that they can't stay with him long, and they both need jobs, so they can get out of there soon.

norm: It's wrong to argue with your mother.
moral_action: Sarah realizes her mother is right about the outfit and tells her that she will go change.
immoral_action: Sarah asks her mother why it's inappropriate and says that she's being too critical, this is what all her friends are wearing.

norm: It's bad to pry into the personal lives of others.
moral_action: Stacy sits down and talks with Larry to see why he has been so secretive.
immoral_action: Stacy goes through Larry's phone.

norm: It is rude to ask personal questions for other people.
moral_action: Phil asks Mike and Jane what their favorite hobby is.
immoral_action: Phil asks Mike and Jane what religion they happen to be.

norm: It's bad to misrepresent yourself in a chatroom.
moral_action: Will starts talking about life, the universe, and everything with the other people.
immoral_action: Will pretends to be a girl and starts flirting with the guys in the chatroom.

norm: It is rude to tell everyone about private messages.
moral_action: Sally talks to her friend about topics of mutual interest but doesn't bring up the text.
immoral_action: Sally tells her friend what her husband wrote to her in the private text message.

norm: It's bad to look in your significant other's private things.
moral_action: Linda directly asks her husband what he was texting about.
immoral_action: Linda looks at her husband's phone at night while he is sleeping.

norm: It's rude to ask personal questions of strangers.
moral_action: Bob asks the stranger about what he does for work.
immoral_action: Bob asks the stranger about his personal love life.

norm: It's wrong to publish someone's secret emails.
moral_action: Crystal calls a close friend and discusses the email she received, in private, asking for advice on how to proceed in the potential relationship.
immoral_action: Crystal posts the full text of her friend's email to her Facebook account as a status, asking her friends for comments.

norm: It's bad to read someone's private conversation without them knowing.
moral_action: Tina casually asks her boyfriend directly what they are talking about.
immoral_action: Tina waits for her boyfriend to go to the bathroom and checks his phone.

norm: It is rude to pester people with personal questions.
moral_action: Debby asks Scott how and where he first met Emma.
immoral_action: Debby asks Scott about his occupation and salary.

norm: It is rude to snoop through other people's private messages.
moral_action: Dave finds a way to casually ask his partner about the nature of their relationship.
immoral_action: Dave takes his partner's phone and starts looking through her messages.

norm: It's rude to pry into a person's private affairs.
moral_action: Nicole stays away from any sensitive topics and just inquires about Betty's general well being.
immoral_action: Nicole repeatedly asks Betty lots of personal questions about her divorce.

norm: It's rude to be snooping on other people's personal lives.
moral_action: Callie takes her food and moves to another table to give the couple privacy.
immoral_action: Callie stays at her table, so she can hear what the couple is talking about.

norm: It is good to accommodate peoples allergies if you can.
moral_action: Tom accommodates his friend and cooks peanut-allergy-friendly dishes.
immoral_action: Tom ignores his friends allergy and makes the main course include peanuts or peanut oil.

norm: It's good to want to take people's mental conditions seriously.
moral_action: John persuades Mary to seek professional help and takes on more responsibility caring for their child.
immoral_action: "John ignores Mary's growing depression and assumes she'll ""snap out of it"" eventually."

norm: It's good to call people to get problems fixed.
moral_action: Dave gets on the phone and calls a professional plumber to come over right away.
immoral_action: Dave goes downstairs and pulls out his tools and attempts to fix the pipe on his own with no expertise.

norm: It's good to inform your landlord of problems.
moral_action: Tom explains his work situation to his landlord, who agrees to allow Tom extra time to pay his rent over the coming months.
immoral_action: Tom starts selling weed to get money to pay his rent.

norm: It's good to speak to your neighbors about problems.
moral_action: Sonya knocks on Rudy's door and lets him know that his TV is too loud late at night.
immoral_action: Sonya complains to the apartment for three nights in a row without ever expressing concern to Rudy.

norm: It's good to help customers with their problems.
moral_action: June helps the customer until the next shift arrives then hands the customer issue over.
immoral_action: June tells the customer to wait for the next shift to come and help her, then leaves the customer to wait.

norm: It's good to tell people your problems.
moral_action: Kathleen tells Julie whats going on in her life and how she feels.
immoral_action: Kathleen decides to keeps her feelings bottled up.

norm: It's good to use words to settle your conflicts.
moral_action: Rhonda tells Amy exactly how she feels and gives Amy a chance to respond.
immoral_action: Rhonda gives Amy the silent treatment and refuses to discuss the issue further.

norm: It is good to let people know of game glitches.
moral_action: Jim reports the glitch to the system before he leaves for home.
immoral_action: Jim doesn't spend the time reporting the glitch before going home.

norm: It's good to look out for your mental health.
moral_action: Bob seeks help about his concerns from a mental health professional.
immoral_action: Bob begins drinking regularly to feel better and forget his problems.

norm: It's good to find resolutions to arguments.
moral_action: Mary decides to help Ted with any losses he occurred and resolves the conflict.
immoral_action: Mary decides to leave the room without resolving the argument.

norm: It's good to give people space to process a tragedy.

immoral_action: Jade offers to take Noor out on the town to party and forget his sadness.

norm: It's encouraged to resolve conflicts amicably.

immoral_action: Basil gets out of his car and tells Austin that he should probably wipe the floor with him for being so rude.

norm: It's smart to talk about one's grief with others.
moral_action: Frank tells Andy that he's been going through some mental anguish, and he's not feeling great about it.
immoral_action: Frank tells Andy that nothing is wrong, and he simply is concentrating on some thoughts, so he might look weird.

norm: It's good to help people out with their problems.
moral_action: Jennifer walks up to her coworker and asks him if he would like some help with the problem.
immoral_action: Jennifer decides to work out the problem on her own and submits the solution to her supervisor before her coworker does.

norm: It's good to get help with your mental issues.
moral_action: Brody goes to the doctor's office and gets a prescription for antidepressants.
immoral_action: Brody takes a handful of pills from the medicine cabinet at his mother's house.

norm: It's good to try to talk through disagreements.

immoral_action: Zelda tells her friend to leave her alone and that she will just do the puzzle herself.

norm: It's good to tell your friends about your problems.

immoral_action: Matthew tells Nick that he has some problems that are too private to discuss with him and that he's seeking professional help for them.

norm: It's good to admit when you have a problem.

immoral_action: Gin drinks until she is admitted to the hospital and required to go to inpatient rehab.

norm: It's good to be direct with someone who upset you.
moral_action: Bill lets Bob know that what he said is not OK and that if they are to remain friends that cannot happen again.
immoral_action: Bill does not say anything to Bob about the transgression and let's Bob get away with it.

norm: It's good to keep your composure when you are upset.
moral_action: Stacy calmly explains how the coworker is wrong and exactly what is wrong with his reasoning.
immoral_action: Stacy unloads a torrent of screaming and profanity at the coworker.

norm: It's good to be there for others who are upset.
moral_action: Lilian spends the evening with her lonely friend, and they watch a great comedy together.
immoral_action: Lilian tells her friend she is not free on Saturday evening and goes out with other friends instead.

norm: It's nice to offer advice when someone is confused.
moral_action: Noelle encourages the new worker to ask them questions when they don't know what to do.
immoral_action: Noelle tells the new hire that they'll be let go if they can't learn on their own.

norm: It is good to care for something that is helpless.
moral_action: Diana holds the dog close to her and gives the dog a treat.
immoral_action: Diana pushes the dog outside.

norm: It's good to help out the hard of hearing.

immoral_action: Sally understands what the guide is saying, but doesn't bother to tell Dan what she hears because she doesn't want to take away from her enjoyment.

norm: It's good to say a well-meaning remark to someone struggling.

immoral_action: Claire tells Ashley that it's her fault for the breakup because she has bad taste in men.

norm: It is good to vent your frustrations.

immoral_action: Micky puts on a front for his wife as to not make her share in his situation, and they watch a movie together.

norm: It's good to realize when you're bothering others.

immoral_action: Bob keeps talking to the coworker figuring that they would tell him to stop if they wanted him to.

norm: It is good to control yourself.
moral_action: Paul makes sure to pace his drinking so that he stays present enough to make wise decisions while having fun.
immoral_action: Paul orders drink after drink as he feels it is fueling his good time.

norm: It's good to overcome the things you struggle with.

immoral_action: Ben decides that heroin makes him feel good, so he's going to keep using it.

norm: It's good to assure people when they are worried.

immoral_action: Greg tells Jim that he needs to suck it up and stop thinking about it.

norm: It's wrong to replace people's medication.

immoral_action: Jason swipes the last one of his uncle's prescription pain killers and replaces it with a vitamin.

norm: It's wrong to spread your illness to another person.
moral_action: Tim orders a soup with contact-less delivery.
immoral_action: Tim goes out to the store to buy some cans of soup.

norm: It's wrong to abuse medication.
moral_action: Jane consults a doctor about how to get more energy.
immoral_action: Jane starts taking her sons Adderall to give her an energy boost.

norm: It is wrong to be anti-semetic.
moral_action: Ray hires the best contractor in town who happens to be Jewish.
immoral_action: Ray learns the best contractor in town is Jewish and chooses a lesser skilled contractor.

norm: It's wrong to fake an illness.
moral_action: Jerry asks his boss if he can take some extra time off to go to the concert and his boss agrees.
immoral_action: Jerry pretends to be sick, so he can get out of work and go to the concert.

norm: It's wrong to use your illness to your advantage.
moral_action: Kati uses some logic to outwit her friend in this argument.
immoral_action: Kati asks her friend how she can be happy fighting with a person who has cancer.

norm: It is wrong to tamper with someone's prescribed medications
moral_action: Phil makes a persuasive argument for the couple starting a family.
immoral_action: Phil switches out May's birth control medication.

norm: It's wrong to take your child's medication.
moral_action: Kaito drinks two cups of his favorite coffee before he continues working.
immoral_action: Kaito takes a pill of his son's adderall without asking his son.

norm: It's wrong to give disease.
moral_action: Paul stays home and pays someone to deliver his medicine to the door.
immoral_action: Paul goes to the store to pick up his medicine even though he knows he could spread the disease.

norm: It's unacceptable to use someone else's medication.

immoral_action: Knowing that Gene is on pain meds, Eddie digs through the medicine cabinet to find them and shares them with the party.

norm: It's not good to use someone else's prescriptions.

immoral_action: Heather takes one of her mom's prescription sleeping pills to help her sleep.

norm: It is bad to bully people online
moral_action: Anna has an informative discussion about who she thinks will win the election with another forum user.
immoral_action: Anna berates a person who doesn't agree with her views and calls them racist names.

norm: It is wrong to bully online.
moral_action: Stephen asks his friend to cover the costs of the necessary repairs.
immoral_action: Stephen insults and threatens his friend in a chat group for his damage.

norm: It is bad to stalk or creep on people online
moral_action: Mark sends her a message and asks if she wants to catch up.
immoral_action: Mark follows her every move online and obsesses over every post.

norm: It's bad to treat people rudely online.

immoral_action: Marry tells Sarah that she should pay attention because her question has been asked several times on the subreddit.

norm: It's bad to behave poorly on the internet.

immoral_action: James logs onto an internet forum and deploys a wide array of profanity against people with different political beliefs.

norm: It's rude to ghost someone online.

norm: It's bad to air your dirty laundry on social media.

norm: It's rude to troll others on social media.

norm: Cyber bullying is wrong.

immoral_action: Shanna messages Kayleigh telling her she'll never be able to style the dress the way she can, and proceeds to taunt her for the rest of the week.

norm: It's petty to dislike videos online for trivial reasons.

immoral_action: Lucas dislikes the videos because he doesn't like the company that sponsored them.

norm: It's bad to stalk an ex on social media.

immoral_action: Jerry asks his friends to spy on his ex's facebook page for him.

norm: It's rude to be mean to people on the internet.

immoral_action: Alex responds by telling the person why their viewpoint is wrong, and goes on to insult the person's intelligence.

norm: It's bad to misrepresent yourself online.

norm: It's bad to mock someone online.

immoral_action: Kairi retweets the tweet with a comment about the poster's intelligence in a sarcastic tone.

norm: It is rude to embarass your significant other online
moral_action: Mira retweets some of the funny stories and tags her friends.

immoral_action: Steven starts looking into Shawn's facebook, looking into all of his recent follows and adding them.

norm: It's rude and annoying to stalk other people online.

immoral_action: Amber sends the hairstylist multiple messages and comments on all of the photo's they upload.

norm: It's rude to be mean to someone online.

norm: It's bad to be an online bully.

norm: It's wrong to be hateful online.

norm: It's wrong to cheat on your girlfriend.

immoral_action: Bill starts going to BDSM orgies without telling Jessica.

norm: It's dishonest to cheat on your significant other
moral_action: Dave tells the woman  that while she's beautiful he cannot go home with her since he's promised to someone else.
immoral_action: Dave tells the woman that she is amazingly beautiful and that he would love to come home with her.

norm: It's bad to annoy people.
moral_action: Berry runs upstairs to play an online video game.
immoral_action: Berry asks his mother to play outside with him over and over again while poking her leg.

norm: It's bad to be prejudiced against others.
moral_action: John hires the black job applicant because they are the most qualified for the position.
immoral_action: John hires the white job applicant despite being less qualified because he is prejudiced against minorities.

norm: It's bad to intentionally harm yourself.
moral_action: Stan seeks professional help for his depression.
immoral_action: Stan cuts himself with a knife.

norm: It's bad to exercise to the point of injury.
moral_action: Anthony consults a nutritionist on some lifestyle changes he can make over time.
immoral_action: Anthony starts off doing extreme workouts with no experience whatsoever.

norm: It's bad to do things that are illegal.
moral_action: Joe only goes the maximum limit that he's allowed to on the road to work.
immoral_action: Joe speeds to get to work, going much faster than the posted limits.

norm: It is bad to do harm to others.
moral_action: Chad asks the teenagers to move out of the way so that he can enter the store.
immoral_action: Chad plows through the teens, shoving them to the ground and enters the store.

norm: It's bad to misrepresent yourself to others.
moral_action: Chuck begins a class to obtain the needed certification and notes it on his application.
immoral_action: Chuck asserts that he possesses the required certification even though he actually does not.

norm: It's bad to intentionally disrupt others.
moral_action: Kevin waits until the scientist is done with the talk to ask his question at the Q&A section.
immoral_action: Kevin asks the question in the middle of the scientist's talk while the scientist is speaking.

norm: It's bad to commit crimes.

immoral_action: Warren tells his friends every detail so that they invest in Warren's company before the big news is announced.

norm: It is bad to put others' lives at risk
moral_action: Jim has friends over but decides to try the drug first before offering it to them.
immoral_action: Jim invites a few friends over and convinces them to try the new drug with him.

norm: It's bad to boss people around.

immoral_action: Henrik takes control of the game deciding what each of his classmates should be doing and correcting them if they stray from his instructions.

norm: It is bad to do risky and dangerous things
moral_action: Clement asks Jess to give him a ride back home.
immoral_action: Clement drives his car back home despite the intoxication.

norm: It's bad to try to make someone relapse.
moral_action: Reggie acknowledges Sandy trying to get over her alcoholism and only offers her non-alcoholic drinks.
immoral_action: Reggie offers Sandy a drink, even though he knows about her alcoholic past.

norm: It's bad to stab people.
moral_action: James insults the other man back, and dodges when he attempts to punch James.
immoral_action: James pulls out a switchblade and plunges it into the man's neck.

norm: It's bad to insult people.
moral_action: Mitch tells James that he has a bright future in politics and tells him not to give up.
immoral_action: Mitch tells James that maybe he should become a rapper instead.

norm: It's bad to think about hurting yourself.
