immoral_action: Salvatore heavily considers cutting himself, hearing that it helps people feel better.

norm: It's bad to make a bomb threat.

immoral_action: Larry threatens to explode his neighbors house if they don't tone down the noise.

norm: It is bad to do things to hurt others.

immoral_action: Ron hits his sister to get his parents' attention, then throws a tantrum and calls them all stupid.

norm: It's bad to violate human rights.
moral_action: Jeff takes Jim's video games away for a month.
immoral_action: Jeff locks Jim in a closet for a month.

norm: It's bad to break things that don't belong to you.
moral_action: Carl puts his video game controller on the floor and walks out of the room.
immoral_action: Carl takes the video game console and throws it on the floor.

norm: It's bad to overstay your welcome.
moral_action: Miguel finds his own place to live and brings his things from Mike's place.
immoral_action: Miguel goes to sleep on the couch at Mike's house again.

norm: It is bad to pressure others.

immoral_action: Jim starts calling Terry a chicken when he says that he doesn't want to go to the mine.

norm: It's bad to fall back on bad habits.

immoral_action: Calvin decides to have some vodka and orange juice to relax him.

norm: It's bad to make plans to commit a crime.

immoral_action: Joel comes up with a plan to rob a local sandwich shop for money.

norm: It is bad to shame others.

immoral_action: Gill tells Maria that no one will date her if she is fat.

norm: It is bad to vandalize others.

immoral_action: James waits until his neighbor is asleep, then spray paints a crudely drawn anus on his garage door.

norm: It's bad to cause inconvenience for others.
moral_action: Joe hires a taxi and goes to the mall that way.
immoral_action: Joe begs his roommates to drive him to the mall and says it's an emergency.

norm: It is bad to want to harm others.

immoral_action: Ty walks over to the man and knocks him out cold.

norm: It is bad to make people feel scared
moral_action: Ursula reads the children book after book until she sees that they are all sound asleep and tucks them in.
immoral_action: Ursula tells the children a tall tale about mysterious things that happen to children who leave their rooms at night and how they might vanish.

norm: It is bad to neglect relationships.
moral_action: Arnie decides to take his whole family out to see a movie they all like to watch together.
immoral_action: Arnie decides to watch TV and read some books before going to bed.

norm: It's bad to partake in illegal activities.
moral_action: Jess buys the new streaming service in order to watch the movie.
immoral_action: Jess downloads the film off of a website from Mexico without paying.

norm: It’s bad to let your curiosity lead to danger.
moral_action: Ted looks up how electrical outlets work on the internet.
immoral_action: Ted plays with the electrical outlet in his room.

norm: It is bad to rude to others.
moral_action: Adam asks people to move as he navigates the crowd.
immoral_action: Adam shoves his way through the crowd calling everyone names.

norm: It's bad to assault others.

immoral_action: Tommy decides to punch David in the jaw, knocking him over in front of the neighborhood.

norm: It's bad to make a creepy move on someone.
moral_action: Benjamin engages with Tina about her interests and compliments her on her personality.
immoral_action: Benjamin makes some suggestive comments towards Tina and drapes his arm around her.

norm: It is bad to hit others.

immoral_action: Carl hits the boy and takes the toy back from him.

norm: Causing people to be uncomfortable and fearful is bad.

immoral_action: Oliver dresses up as a ninja and covers his face and brings real knives to the party.

norm: It is bad to let grooming become an obsessive behavior.

immoral_action: George tries multiple new hairstyles to on the wedding day to find one he likes most and ends up being very late.

norm: It's bad to scare someone you know is vulnerable.

immoral_action: Dean buys a fake gun and pretends to be a robber breaking into Graham's room.

norm: It is bad to judge things for being weird.

norm: It's bad to be overly dramatic.

immoral_action: Jill walks up to Bill and tells him that if he doesn't date her she'll kill herself.

norm: It's bad to do things to others that are wrong.
moral_action: Ted handicaps himself by not using the most powerful techniques, then still manages to emerge victorious.
immoral_action: Ted helps defeat the computer opponent, then turns against each of his allies and backstabs all of them.

norm: It is bad to want harm on anyone even yourself.
moral_action: Adam tells his parents how he has been feeling and asks to get medical help.
immoral_action: Adam takes up cutting to relieve his stress after he hears it's used as a release by others in his position.

norm: It's bad to bother other people.

immoral_action: Hayden turns his speaker up to full volume.

norm: It's bad to hit someone.

immoral_action: Patrick hits the man knocking him to the floor and tells him to leave his girlfriend alone.
